name: places/ChIJMZEqPaVZwokR_pc8BKhIFfE

displayName.text: Dr. Jeffrey Ditzell Psychiatry | #1 NYC Psychiatrist | Ketamine Therapy, ADHD, PTSD, Anxiety, & Depression treatment

adrFormatAddress: 65 Broadway # 901, New York, NY 10006, USA

originalText.text: Mental heath challenges do not restrict themselves to working hours. Once you acknowledge this, especially as a caregiver, you appreciate a mental health professional who is on call 24 hours (in our case 7:00am on a July 4th holiday). Available, focussed, perceptive and empathetic, but firm. The journey to recovery often requires a push, and Dr Ditzell will not hesitate to tell you even what you don’t want to hear…I have noted more progress in the last 2 years than in the 7 years prior with different providers. Thank you!

Thank you!

originalText.text:
**I should note this is the second time I've ever google reviewed anything (the first was for an amazing upholsterer in LA...he asked me to write a review)**

I am writing it in an attempt to protect anyone from seeing this grossly unethical and unprofessional provider.

Historically, I am fastidious in selecting my healthcare providers. Before seeing a provider, I vet their educational background and academic/research publications.

However, since I had just moved back to NYC and my former NYC practice was completely booked, I went against my better judgement and saw the "#1 psychiatrist in New York" who had no research that I could find on google. I did this because my psychiatry needs are pretty simple and I have a therapist for my psychotherapy needs. What could go wrong?

For privacy and legal reasons, I won't detail the psychological-thriller-esque experience I had with this provider. However, I will say that he was comfortable blatantly lying about the facts of my sessions with him and lying about my family history --I suspect to cover his unethical practice.

His lies on my medical records became apparent to me after I reviewed the medical records from his practice that I requested. They were (finally) released to me after my fourth request. In my fourth attempt, I cited the HIPPA statue that entitles patients access to their records. I promptly received them.

It should be noted that I received my falsified records AFTER I sent him an email detailing his reckless and concerning treatment of me. In this email, I cc'd my therapist, both of my prior psychiatrists, and other relevant entities.

It's still unclear this provider's motivation for all of this. I did think it was strange that in our first session he asked me if I was "famous" (I should have ran for the hills at that moment).

It's interesting that in the session where he began to completely turn and terrify me I definitely did not look "famous." I looked like a woman who has acute stress disorder--a victim of domestic violence related stalking by a "famous adjacent" ex-boyfriend--a fact that this provider knew about for months but suddenly decided it could just be a "non-bizarre delusion."

I promptly called the NYC hotline for gender-based violence and they advised me to report this incident so it doesn't, "happen to anyone else."

Additionally, my mother who has also experienced/witnessed the stalking from my ex-partner called this doctor on my behalf. I was so shook and she was disturbed by his treatment of me. During this call, I jumped on the phone. I asked him if he ever spoke to my ex. He replied, "my team knows about your case and has never released your HIPPA protected information..."

Lastly, based on my experience, I fear retaliatory action from this provider for writing this review. However, I believe it is important information for anyone considering seeing this provider.

originalText.text: Dr. Ditzell been an incredible help in my mental health journey. Even for complex cases like myself, he truly assisted in pulling myself out of an extremely dark space.

text.text: Dr. Ditzell been an incredible help in my mental health journey. Even for complex cases like myself, he truly assisted in pulling myself out of an extremely dark space.

originalText.text: I have been seeing Dr. Ditzell for about 3 years now and the results have been life changing for me.  I have become the professional that I have always wanted to be in his care, on top of achieving great progress in my personal life and inner emotional world.  He is a wonderful role model for me and for so many others, and I am so grateful that Dr. Ditzell is my doctor.

originalText.text: Arrogant, unhelpful staff,  all about the money, think twice  I don't usually leave reviews but with mental health I think this is valid info for others in there  journey to help.
